resources.string: What Side of Your Brain Is Dominant?
Please check one box that describes the race/ethnicity category with which you primarily identify.
Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander
You are a person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America).
You are a person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent.
You are a person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.
You are a person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.
You are a person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.

1. Are you good at following directions?
2. Are you more likely to get lost in something or have trouble concentrating?
I tend to get too absorbed with something.
I have trouble with concentration and focus.
Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.
Punctuality is the thief of adventure.
6. Which statement reflects your beliefs more?
I have a strong sense of right and wrong.
What\'s right or wrong depends on the situation.
7. In an argument or heated discussion, you find it most important to:

The left side of your brain is more dominant.\nYou are a verbally and mathematically adept person. You notice details, and you are very precise. Errors and mistakes drive you crazy. You are a perfectionist in almost every aspect of your life!

The right side of your brain is more dominant.\nDaring and intuitive, you see the world in your unique way. You are all about creativity and flexibility. You have a broad perspective on the world. You may be a bit chaotic, but you never get stuck in a rut!

Your brain is a healthy mix of logic and creativity.\nYou are both sensitive and savvy. Rational and reasonable, you have a very fluid way of thinking. You follow through on the plans you make and you also are a complex person.
